timeline.headline: A Little Bit About Myself
timeline.text: Keywords: Front-end Engineer, Father, Disc Golfer, Stargazer, Gardener, Gamer, Geek, Soccer Player, Scale Modeller, Piano Player, Spurs Fan, Freelancer, Teacher, Writer, Designer, Developer, et cetera.

asset.caption: My Son, Edan, and Me

date.headline: Birth
date.text: My Birthday

asset.caption: Me at two weeks old

date.headline: Fell off horse → Broke collarbone
date.text: When I was three, my sister, brother and myself were out for a neighborhood horseride. As we returned home, we began to head up a steep uphill path. A combination of the incline, being seated in the rear of an overcrowded saddle, and being three years old, I lost my grip and fell backwards off the horse. My shoulder caught the brunt of the fall, resulting in a clean snap of my clavicle.

date.headline: Stepped on by horse → ER visit
date.text: When I was five, my sister and I were at a local rodeo. We just finished a short ride on her horse to get to her friends. As I was getting off from the horse, I slipped and fell to the ground. The sound spooked the horse, who, in an attempt to step away from me, stepped on me in two spots. This was my first and only ambulance ride.

date.headline: Disneyworld (but not really)
date.text: Took my first airplane trip by myself to go visit my childhood friend who had moved to Florida earlier that year. I got sick the night I arrived and we were rained out of our trip to Blizzard Beach. We never made it to DisneyWorld (although I did have an amazingly fun time).

asset.caption: Even at a subsidiary park, the lines were still too long.

date.headline: <html>
date.text: I typed my first html tag (<font>) in an attempt to spice up my email signature for my WebTV email address.

asset.caption: Anyone else remember this screen?

date.headline: Created first website
date.text: I published my first personal website on my brother's server space from his University. Contents included: Frames, Best of Boerne Police Blotter, links to various resources on the web, and a page with a flying animated gif of Ralph Wiggum eating paste

asset.caption: Now just imagine it floating around the screen

date.headline: Broke Collarbone (again)
date.text: I broke my other clavicle while sprinting down the side of the soccer field when an opposing player tripped me up, sending me shoulder first into the hard ground.

date.headline: Site: A Gift and A Card
date.text: A friend of a friend wanted a website for their homemade greeting card business. Wanting a challenge, I spent the next year and a half learning PHP, MySQL and general application development. In hindsight, an out-of-the-box solution would have been much better, but the things I learned from that project propelled me to where I am today.

asset.caption: Not the greatest of designs, but I was certainly proud of it at the time.

date.headline: Proposed to Katie Lewis (Then climbed Guadalupe Peak)
date.text: In the early Spring of 2006, I proposed to Katie Lewis. We then took a trip west to Carlsbad Caverns and Guadalupe Mountains National Park. At GMNP, Katie and I took an 8-hour round-trip hike up to the peak of Texas. I'm still not sure which was harder, climbing the mountain or proposing to a girl.

asset.caption: Hey Katie, remember the mini-static lightining?

date.headline: Graduated College
date.text: After three years of coursework, I earned my Bachelor of Arts in Arts and Technology. Some topics I studied while there: Web Development, 3D Modeling, Java, Film, Piano, Writing, Entrepreneurship, Game Design, Photography, Sketching, Sculpture

date.headline: Site: Texas Green Campaign
date.text: Committed to improving Texas air quality, Texas Green Campaign hoped to create a web presence in a hurry. In less than a week, I was able to implement the design along with programming a "Tell a Friend" e-mail page to help spread the word about improving Texas air quality.

asset.caption: This tiny screenshot is all that's left of the website

date.headline: Site: Next Frame Photography
date.text: As an ultimate compliment to my work, the owners of KB Media Productions returned for another website. This time, they wanted a photo gallery with a smoother feel. Through a custom Javascript/PHP application, I was able to deliver a great website for the second time in a row.

asset.caption: Unfortunately it's another tiny screenshot.

date.headline: Elastic Images
date.text: One of the biggest disadvantages of using css-based image replacement is the loss of scalability. Graphics have been notiorously known to scale poorly, resulting in jagged edges, especially noticable on words and straight edges. This slightly out-dated article covers an alternative approach to this issue.

date.headline: Trip to Germany
date.text: Travelled overseas to see Katie's brother (and wife and son). Sprechen Sie Deutsch? Full photo set

asset.caption: Archway over Landstuhl
Travelled to Half-moon Bay, Yosemite. Full Set

date.headline: Beginner Web Standards FAQs
date.text: Spurred on by a co-worker, I wrote up a short list of FAQ for standards-based web development for beginners.

asset.caption: In May of 2007, I married Katie Lewis at St. Peter the Apostle Catholic Church.

date.headline: Known Techniques For Constructing Effectively Optimized Cascading Style Sheets
date.text: There are several advantages to sliming down your CSS. Not only does it lower bandwidth costs, it also makes editing the CSS easier because there is less code to look through. Use these simple techniques to speed up and slim down your cascading styles.

date.headline: Site: Patty Mohlke Photography
date.text: Patty Mohlke, 1951-2009, was a freelance photographer who wanted to share the beauty she saw in the world with others. To help her vision, I created a PHP/MySQL photography website where she could upload and sell her photographs.

asset.caption: Just one of Patty's many wonderful photographs.
Freelance development work for Reeves Design House. Built on Wordpress. View Website

date.headline: Became a Teacher
date.text: In the fall of 2008, I decided to become a High School Teacher. I blogged about it some.

asset.media: “The first question asked when I was interviewing for my teaching job was, ‘Why do you want to be a teacher?’ It’s an extremely important question, because sooner or later, you’re going to second guess your choice.”
asset.credit: My post on Why I Want to Teach

date.headline: Is Click Here the Best Choice?
date.text: The words 'click here' have grown to cover the web. The phrase is used to indicate links as calls to action. While some claim that visitors key in on those two words, using 'click here' and its siblings 'Read More' and 'Continue' can create accessibility and usability issues. Here's why 'Click Here' might not be the best choice.

date.headline: Woke up to a brand new world
date.text: On the morning of July 12th, Katie Lamping woke me up excitedly with a positive pregnancy test strip. My first reaction? Laughing.

asset.caption: My Son: 7lbs 14oz, 20in, Edan (meaning: perfect), Patrick (after Aunt Patty, St. Patrick's Day, and our friend Patrick)

date.headline: Screencast: YUI 3's Use and Add Methods

asset.caption: YUI 3 introduces a new module system built upon two new methods: add() and use(). This video provides a brief introduction to those two functions.
